{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3323931,"name":"Andy Mundell","username":"suPURDUEperAndy","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/supurdueperandy/{size}/266209_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-04T23:14:34.928Z","cooked":"

Looking for opinions from those with more experience. We’ve got a pulley ratio that we think we’d like to tweak and optimize, but we don’t want to remake some parts and adjust center to center distances. There are some pulley ratios that can come pretty close to what we want with similar CC distances, but nothing exact. I’ve gone with options that make the belt a bit loose before and they usually work out, but I’d really like a well tensioned belt here.

Has anyone ever tried reprinting a 3dp pulley at 101% or so to keep tension? Would this do more harm than good with tooth engagement?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2024-03-04T23:14:34.928Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":22,"reads":227,"readers_count":226,"score":170.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":457276,"topic_slug":"belt-tension-in-3dp-pulleys","display_username":"Andy Mundell","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/how-to-design-with-belts/466090/11","internal":true,"reflection":true,"title":"How to design with belts","clicks":1}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":36711,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"7457 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/belt-tension-in-3dp-pulleys/457276/1","custom_user_title":"7457 Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3323956,"name":"Chadfrom7226","username":"Chadfrom7226","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/chadfrom7226/{size}/113429_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-04T23:34:08.789Z","cooked":"

We print ours at 100% and never had any issue with it. We have done pulleys for intakes, shooters, and robot arms

I think adding a tensioner is your best bet if you are having issues, or modifying your c-c distance slightly

Edit: Maybe your printer calibration is off? Maybe your motor/axle is not held rigidly and is bending slightly?

Also - just try it and report back with what you find. 3D printing is cheap enough

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2024-03-04T23:35:30.432Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":218,"readers_count":217,"score":63.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":457276,"topic_slug":"belt-tension-in-3dp-pulleys","display_username":"Chadfrom7226","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":20021,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/belt-tension-in-3dp-pulleys/457276/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3323962,"name":"Milo Higa","username":"saadaki","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/saadaki/{size}/215982_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-04T23:39:36.348Z","cooked":"

I would advise against scaling a 3DP pulley in the xy plane. You might run into issues of your pitches being mismatched and preventing engagement of the belt. I read in another CD thread of increasing your tooth count of your 3DP pulley by 1 to increase tension but have not tried that personally. Our temporary fix for one of our loose belts was just tying a zip tie around the slack.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2024-03-04T23:39:36.348Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":201,"readers_count":200,"score":65.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":457276,"topic_slug":"belt-tension-in-3dp-pulleys","display_username":"Milo Higa","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":43713,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"2445 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/belt-tension-in-3dp-pulleys/457276/3","custom_user_title":"2445 Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3323977,"name":"Sam","username":"clydefrog88","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/clydefrog88/{size}/150683_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-05T00:01:21.772Z","cooked":"

We’ve tweaked tooth counts 1-2 teeth on one side of HTD runs that didn’t match design due to whatever manufacturing tolerance or slop. It’s worked well for applications that weren’t affected by the small change in ratio.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2024-03-05T00:02:04.011Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":166,"readers_count":165,"score":33.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":457276,"topic_slug":"belt-tension-in-3dp-pulleys","display_username":"Sam","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":43713,"username":"saadaki","name":"Milo Higa","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/saadaki/{size}/215982_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":7309,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/belt-tension-in-3dp-pulleys/457276/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3323981,"name":"Andy Mundell","username":"suPURDUEperAndy","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/supurdueperandy/{size}/266209_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-05T00:07:14.614Z","cooked":"

I think you misunderstood. We print at 100% and do just fine, but i dont want to remake a part to fix c-c distances that are only off by 0.02 in.

I’m already changing tooth count. Im talking about removing that extra little bit of slack.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2024-03-05T00:07:14.614Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":151,"readers_count":150,"score":60.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":457276,"topic_slug":"belt-tension-in-3dp-pulleys","display_username":"Andy Mundell","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":20021,"username":"Chadfrom7226","name":"Chadfrom7226","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/chadfrom7226/{size}/113429_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":36711,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"7457 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/belt-tension-in-3dp-pulleys/457276/5","custom_user_title":"7457 Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3323991,"name":"Andy Mundell","username":"suPURDUEperAndy","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/supurdueperandy/{size}/266209_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-05T00:21:09.144Z","cooked":"

We would already adjust tooth count. Im talking about the tiny bit extra for a snug fit (about 0.02" extra c-c)

I understand that adjusting the size will affect tooth engagement. I want to know if anybody has practical experience with how much you could potentially oversize a pulley before noticing it and whether that is better or worse than a slightly loose belt.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2024-03-05T00:21:09.144Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":137,"readers_count":136,"score":32.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":457276,"topic_slug":"belt-tension-in-3dp-pulleys","display_username":"Andy Mundell","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":43713,"username":"saadaki","name":"Milo Higa","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/saadaki/{size}/215982_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":36711,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"7457 Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/belt-tension-in-3dp-pulleys/457276/6","custom_user_title":"7457 Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3324066,"name":"Rod","username":"Weldingrod1","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/weldingrod1/{size}/162109_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-05T01:39:25.772Z","cooked":"

If its a 5mm pitch and the error is 0.02 inches, you are already perfect!!!
If its 3mm pitch, that’s still darn good!

Scaling the pulley won’t do what you want.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2024-03-05T01:39:25.772Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":110,"readers_count":109,"score":57.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":457276,"topic_slug":"belt-tension-in-3dp-pulleys","display_username":"Rod","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":46443,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/belt-tension-in-3dp-pulleys/457276/7","custom_user_title":"Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3324393,"name":"Chadfrom7226","username":"Chadfrom7226","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/chadfrom7226/{size}/113429_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-05T14:46:24.905Z","cooked":"

That is a good question. I bet you could do another 1% oversized, but I would be worried about teeth not meshing properly

I would try it and report back. Hopefully it’s not major surgery to swap out

You could always go the belt tensioner route as well
